reviews.text: This is our fourth stay at Spinnaker, we didnt want a hotel experience, been there done that. My children are early teens and wouldnt appreciate being cooped up in a hotel room.
reviews.title: Third stay at this wonderful place

reviews.text: We have stayed in 2 of the three bedroom units and 2 of the two bed units. All have been furnished to the individual owners taste, so all units are different. Each has a log burner, heaters, electric blankets so being cold will not be an issue. All apartments have fab views over lake Wakatipu and all our very very comfortable. It also gives us the choice to eat in instead of looking for somewhere to eat.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: There is a heated pool, sauna, the driveway is heated in winter months to prevent it icing over. The driveway is steep, just takes a little skillfull driving to the garaging, we have a huge 4wd
reviews.title: Perfect for family or large group

likes.liked: — I forgot to mention it! The amazing view.

reviews.text: Queenstown centre is a an easy 15 min walk along the lake side and through Jubilee park.
reviews.title: Unfriendly Management
Unhanded dealings after cancellation was made
reviews.text: It is a great place to stay and I do not bother looking anywhere in QT for other accomodation, its a little expensive but two hotel rooms of equal standard would be the same and we would be separated, and another point, one of the local supermarkets provides online shopping and delivery, so you can have any essentials delivered.

We thoroughly enjoyed staying at these luxury units. Great views over the lake and a pleasant 20 minute walk into the centre of queenstown. The units are very well equipped. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Luxury units with great views

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment sitting just above the lake. The lake view and mountains were spectacular. Even though its a short walk to the centre of town, the location on a steep incline with surrounding vegetation meant it was remarkably quiet and private.
reviews.title: Magic view/ location, spacious & comfortable apartment, warm pool

reviews.text: There was a well equipped kitchen, spacious lounge and bedrooms, and a balcony overlooking the lapping lake which was very pleasant accompanied with sunshine and a glass of wine.
reviews.title: Brilliant - a real home

reviews.text: The children spent time in the heated pool. The surrounding garden needed a bit of work. But the car enjoyed a garage. The free internet access was an added bonus.
reviews.title: Stunning views, lovely apartment

reviews.text: This definitely falls into the luxury area of the market. Its not cheap, but the comfort it offers for the whole family was worth it. If we return to Queenstown, this is where we will be wanting to stay.
reviews.title: Nice accommodation, but overrated on tripAdvisor
Wonderful apartments!
reviews.text: Having cut short an unsatisfactory stay at a competitor up the road, I chanced upon the Spinaker Bay apartments. Compared to where I'd been before it was like stepping out of a Holiday Inn to a St Regis. Good architecture, orientation, natural light and furnishing, with stunning views over the Frankton arm of lake Wakatipu.

reviews.title: Wouldn't stay there if they paid me!!!!
reviews.text: The secret I think is because each apartment is owned by an individual who no doubt uses it himself from time to time, and this is reflected in highly personal choice of things like crockery, cutlery and audio visual equipment, there is nothing institutional about any of these case in point being a gigantic late model widescreen digital TV.
Highly recommended, though the sloping nature of the sight makes parking a bit of a challenge. Incidently, I was in Unit 3.
reviews.title: Outstanding!
Fantastic accomodation
reviews.text: We haven't even arrived at this property and we are already greatly disappointed. We rang to confirm our booking for this coming Sunday and were told that the price we were quoted (and the deposit we paid) was incorrect and we now owe them an extra $35 per night. We questioned this and were told that we must have stated the wrong number of guests and they weren't in the business of giving money away. We refused to accept the price increase and eventually the manager agreed to stand by the price quoted originally. She then sent us a fax to confirm our details and wrote the new increased charge on this fax. When we once again questioned the price increase, the manager stated that if we couldn't afford to stay at their apartments then we could go and stay somewhere else. Obviously though, it doesn't matter how much money you have, you don't want to be ripped off!!!! We have two small children and luckily we have found some other accommodation in Queenstown at such short notice but I am still extremely offended by the treatment we received from the management of this property and feel very let down by so called kiwi hospitality.
